ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy

Class BasicPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.AbstractWordPolicy
      • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.BasicPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PhoneticHashProvider, WordPolicy

    public class BasicPolicy
extends AbstractWordPolicy
    A language-neutral basic policy that implements common features. By default a SpellingChecker will try to install a PolicyChain that first applies this policy, then a locale-specific policy. (If there is no locale-specific policy available, it uses this policy without chaining.)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.WordPolicy

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public Object evaluate(String word)
        Evaluate a word under this policy. The policy can return the original string, causing the word to be checked normally. Alternatively, it can return a different string as a proxy word to be checked instead of the original word. Finally, it can return one of the special values Evaluation.REJECT_WORD or Evaluation.ACCEPT_WORD. These cause the word to immediately be either rejected as a misspelled word or accepted as a correctly spelled word, respectively. This implementation always returns the original word. This policy automatically accepts words shorter than MINIMUM_WORD_LENGTH and any words that do not contain any letters. Otherwise, it returns the original word unchanged.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        evaluate in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Parameters:
        word - the word being checked by the caller
        Returns:
        the word to be looked up, or an Evaluation code
